body_html:
This happened because evaluation works off of the last checkpoint. Checkpoints are by default saved every 10 minutes (the defaults are good for long-running jobs, not so good for toy examples).

So if you evaluate more than every 10 minutes, you'll get no results or identical results to last time.

Passing the config allows you to override the checkpointing interval, now you write a checkpoint every second (which may now be slowing you down), but you can be pretty sure that your evals are up to date.

I'll close this, there's no bug here (although better documentation would be good).

body:
This happened because evaluation works off of the last checkpoint. Checkpoints are by default saved every 10 minutes (the defaults are good for long-running jobs, not so good for toy examples).

So if you evaluate more than every 10 minutes, you'll get no results or identical results to last time.

Passing the config allows you to override the checkpointing interval, now you write a checkpoint every second (which may now be slowing you down), but you can be pretty sure that your evals are up to date.

I'll close this, there's no bug here (although better documentation would be good).
